bioghist.p: Carolyn Haywood (1898-1990) was an author and illustrator of children's books. She attended the Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts, where she studied with Elizabeth Shippen Green and Jessie Willcox Smith, and where she served as studio assistant for Violet Oakley, the renowned artist and muralist. Haywood herself painted murals in banks and schools throughout Philadelphia, where they can still be viewed today. Her first children's book, When I Grow Up, was published in 1931, and in 1939 she hit her stride with the first of the Betsy and Eddie books, B Is for Betsy. She wrote about the childhood adventures of these two characters for more than fifty years. In her later years, her books were illustrated by other artists.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of manuscripts and illustrations by Haywood. Materials include typescript manuscripts, galley proofs, original and finished art and jacket art. Titles include Away Went the Balloons, B Is for Betsy, Besty and Mr. Kilpatrick, C is for Cupcake, Eddie the Dog Holder, Here Comes the Bus, Merry Christmas from Betsy, Robert Rows the River, A Sundae with Judy, Taffy and Melissa Molasses, and A Valentine Fantasy. The collection also includes illustrations for an edition of Pinocchio which was never published; and a miniature portrait of Haywood by Malthe Hasselriis.
